item.title: The Best Theme Isn't the Prettiest—It's the One You Forget Exists
item.description: Over the past few years, I’ve created numerous Neovim color schemes. My workflow was always the same: pick an existing theme, adjust its colors in HSL space until they felt comfortable, and use it for a while. But invariably, after several weeks or months, the same pattern emerged—visual fatigue. My eyes would tire faster during long coding sessions, colors that once felt “right” started to irritate, and I’d find myself tweaking values again and again.
